    • Method Detail

      • addFutureMeeting

        public int addFutureMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts,
                   java.util.Calendar date)
        Add a new meeting to be held in the future. The program will inform if it's attempted to intoduce a meeting with the same contacts at the same time ,as nothing will prevent adding a meeting with the same features.
        Specified by:
        addFutureMeeting in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contacts - a list of contacts that will participate in the meeting
        date - the date on which the meeting will take place
        Returns:
        the ID for the meeting
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the meeting is set for a time in the past, of if any contact is unknown / non-existent

      • getPastMeeting

        public PastMeeting getPastMeeting(int id)

        Specified by:
        getPastMeeting in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        id - the ID for the meeting
        Returns:
        the meeting with the requested ID, or null if it there is none.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a meeting with that ID happening in the future

      • getFutureMeetingList

        public java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(Contact contact)
        Return the list of future meetings that are scheduled for this contact. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.
        Specified by:
        getFutureMeetingList in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contact - one of the user’s contacts
        Returns:
        the list of future meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the contact does not exist

      • getFutureMeetingList

        public java.util.List<Meeting> getFutureMeetingList(java.util.Calendar date)
        Returns the list of meetings that are scheduled for, or that took place on, the specified date. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.
        Specified by:
        getFutureMeetingList in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        date - the date
        Returns:
        the list of meetings

      • getPastMeetingList

        public java.util.List<PastMeeting> getPastMeetingList(Contact c)
        Returns the list of past meetings in which this contact has participated. If there are none, the returned list will be empty. Otherwise, the list will be chronologically sorted and will not contain any duplicates.
        Specified by:
        getPastMeetingList in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contact - one of the user’s contacts
        Returns:
        the list of future meeting(s) scheduled with this contact (maybe empty).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the contact does not exist

      • addNewPastMeeting

        public void addNewPastMeeting(java.util.Set<Contact> contacts,
                     java.util.Calendar date,
                     java.lang.String text)
        Create a new record for a meeting that took place in the past.
        Specified by:
        addNewPastMeeting in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        contacts - a list of participants
        date - the date on which the meeting took place
        text - messages to be added about the meeting.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the list of contacts is empty, or any of the contacts does not exist
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if any of the arguments is null

      • addMeetingNotes

        public void addMeetingNotes(int id,
                   java.lang.String text)
        Add notes to a meeting. This method is used when a future meeting takes place, and is then converted to a past meeting (with notes). It can be also used to add notes to a past meeting at a later date.
        Specified by:
        addMeetingNotes in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        id - the ID of the meeting
        text - messages to be added about the meeting.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the meeting does not exist
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the meeting is set for a date in the future
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the notes are null

      • addNewContact

        public void addNewContact(java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.String notes)
        Create a new contact with the specified name and notes.
        Specified by:
        addNewContact in interface ContactManager
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the contact.
        notes - notes to be added about the contact.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the name or the notes are null

        public java.util.Set<Contact> getContacts(int... ids)

        Returns:

      • printcontacts

        public void printcontacts()
        This methods prints all the contacts in the contacts_set.

      • printMeeting

        public void printMeeting()
        This methods prints all the meetings in the agenda.

      • generate_id_contact

        public int generate_id_contact()
        This method generates a random contact id between 0 and 1000. For simplicity it has been considered a maximum amount of 1000 contacts. If it is attempted to create more than 1000 the method will enter an infinite loop.
        Returns:
        contact_id,int.

      • generate_id_meeting

        public int generate_id_meeting()
        This method generates a random meeting id between 0 and 1000. For simplicity it has been considered a maximum amount of 1000 meetings. If it is attempted to create more than 1000 the method will enter an infinite loop.
        Returns:
        contact_id,int.

      • flush

        public void flush()
        Save all data to disk. This method is executed when the program is closed and when/if the user requests it.
        Specified by:
        flush in interface ContactManager
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there's a problem with IO.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This methods instantiate an object of ContactManagerImpl and also include the User Interface with several options to add Meetings, get meetings, add new Contacts etc.

        java.io.IOException - ,ClassNotFoundException.
